page.title: 05Landscapes & Buildings cont.
page.content: This area lies in the Vale of York and is flat with slight undulations, the highest point above sea level being 32 metres. It is an agricultural area composed of small to medium sized fields divided by hedgerows,some having mature trees in them. There are several copses and small woods containing coniforus and decidious trees. The area to the east is drined by Derrings Beck which runs through the village of Tholthorpe and the River Ure flows across the south west corner. Bordering the village of Myton on Swale is a large area of privately owned parkland with grazing and mature trees. There is a large village green and pond at Tholthorpe and 2 old farm ponds and 1 on the site of a disused brickworks at Myton-on Swale. On the outskirts of the village is a Civic Amemity Site, it
